com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExceptionHandlers.AbstractExceptionHandler, ExceptionHandlers.DefaultExceptionHandler
    Enclosing class:
    ActivityController

    public static interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
    Defines and splits the handling of various exceptions in a single place. This handler will be invoked once it has been registered.

    The exception handler will be invoked at runtime when an exception is thrown and is not handled. You do not need to log the exception, because the ActivityController already takes care of logging it, before invoking the current interface methods.

    See Also:
    ActivityController.registerExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean onActivityException(android.app.Activity activity, java.lang.Object component, java.lang.Throwable throwable)
      Is invoked whenever an activity implementing LifeCycle throws an unexpected exception outside from the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method.
      boolean onBusinessObjectAvailableException(android.app.Activity activity, java.lang.Object component, LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException exception)
      Is invoked whenever the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() throws an exception.
      boolean onContextException(boolean isRecoverable, android.content.Context context, java.lang.Throwable throwable)
      Is invoked whenever a handled exception is thrown with a non-Activity / Fragment context.
      boolean onException(boolean isRecoverable, java.lang.Throwable throwable)
      Is invoked whenever a handled exception is thrown outside from an available context.

    • Method Detail

      • onBusinessObjectAvailableException

        boolean onBusinessObjectAvailableException(android.app.Activity activity,
                                         java.lang.Object component,
                                         LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException exception)
        Is invoked whenever the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() throws an exception.

        Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity that issued the exception, and which is ensured not to be finishing ; cannot be null
        component - the component that issued the exception ; may be null
        exception - the exception that has been thrown
        Returns:
        true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore

      • onActivityException

        boolean onActivityException(android.app.Activity activity,
                          java.lang.Object component,
                          java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Is invoked whenever an activity implementing LifeCycle throws an unexpected exception outside from the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method.

        This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

        Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity that issued the exception ; cannot be null
        component - the component that issued the exception ; may be null
        throwable - the exception that has been triggered
        Returns:
        true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore

      • onContextException

        boolean onContextException(boolean isRecoverable,
                         android.content.Context context,
                         java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Is invoked whenever a handled exception is thrown with a non-Activity / Fragment context.

        This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

        Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Parameters:
        isRecoverable - indicates whether the application is about to crash when the exception has been triggered
        context - the context that issued the exception
        throwable - the exception that has been triggered
        Returns:
        true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore

      • onException

        boolean onException(boolean isRecoverable,
                  java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Is invoked whenever a handled exception is thrown outside from an available context.

        This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

        Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Parameters:
        isRecoverable - indicates whether the application is about to crash when the exception has been triggered
        throwable - the exception that has been triggered
        Returns:
        true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore
